image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: a Representative from New York; born in Schenectady, Schenectady County, N.Y., January 28, 1977; graduated from Notre Dame-Bishop Gibbons High School, Schenectady, N.Y., 1995; B.A., Colgate University, Hamilton, N.Y., 1999; Rhodes Scholar, M.A., Oxford University, Oxford, England, 2001; J.D., Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass., 2005; musician; lawyer, private practice; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Sixteenth and to the succeeding Congress until his resignation on May 25, 2022 (January 3, 2019-May 25, 2022); lieutenant governor of New York, 2022-present.
